Reviews.Title: “Worth of money”
Reviews.Author: jamyou
Reviews.Content: After finish the stay in Hilton Manhattan East Hotel and I want to stay one more night in NYC, then I turn to St. Mark Hotel at St. Mark Place which near University, around it have lot of restaurant and bar, the restaurant type include Japanese, Taiwan drink, Russian food, steak house, pizza (only US$1 per pieces, hehehehee). and around there also have a vintage shop which selling the second hand stuff like shoes, boot, leather jacket some of them really nice and not really expensive. The hotel is small sand seems a budget hotel, no fancy decoration, no resaurant, it is only provide accomodation. My friend search a hotel not expensive with me and we walk there, one single room with bathroom only US$100 !!! Do you know it is so hard to found a room in the central of NYC middle town which is so near everything eating and buy and sightseeing. subway is not far away, plus tax it only charge me US$110. Room is small just have a regular bathroom which including shower, sink, toilet bowl, the water seems not really hot and a bit mal-function cause I turn the hot water for 1 mins but it seems not hot and I didn't get help. The toilet seat have cigarette burning mark, the sink for face washing is so narrow. But it still provide tower , shower gel, shampoo, conditioner. On the wall side there have a heater, at the beginning there have some sound and I worry will it explose ??? it won't. After soon it getting quite. I live in 1 floor, the view is facing the street, nice and wide, full of sunshine and tree, facing a building ( I think it is a school or smiliar) by a widing road, like you living in a quarter, with nice view, building, tree, square, ....despite the window is narrow and long. Inside the room not much facilities, but the essential item it will have like heate, TV, bathroom. But there have NO safety box, wrobeboard with door, mp3 speaker, Everything is simply and basic. Want do you expect for a room just cost u US$100 in NYC so bustling and expensive place. Everything eat, shop, sightseeing is so nearby, and that place I think is the cheaper place for eat and shop and drink (lot of bar around), and lot of trendy and modern ppl there, handsome guy and beautiful girl walk around. Nearby have University, so this area is fully of energy. If you have not must expect for a hotel or a room and you got not much money, this hotel is really suit for you. At least you got your own bathroom in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: madammermaid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. Pleasant staff, felt safe, great price, descent bed, fun location for young adults and tidy. I didn't come home with bed bugs and didn't spend a fortune, good enough for me! Only downsides: Cash only, the ATM wasn't working either. COLD shower. I didn't say anything about the shower since it was the 1 night so I can't say they did or didn't attempt to fix it. Loud street. I took a sleeping pill so I slept straight through the night, but one of my friends said she woke up. These are minor things and I will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic. Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: kika1969
Reviews.Content: Location in pretty awesome, just beginning of the 3rd avenue. Area is cool ( hippie/arty/punk/alternative) lot´s of little shops to visit and pleanty of nice restaurants near by. Just few steps to Astor Pl tubestation. Hotel is really basic, nothing fancy but clean. Bit worn out thou. People at the reception were helpful. Our room was at the first floor, windows just across the noisy street. Take ear-plugs with you!! Room was a bit small for two of us and there weren´t a proper wardrobes. There was a cafe/deli downstairs of us, so our room was pretty hot. It was handy thou because it was quite chilly outside. Our room was cleaned every day and towels were changed too. Overall i would stay there again because of the location and price!

Reviews.Title: “Only a little nicer than a hostel”
Reviews.Author: kst101
Reviews.Content: My 18-year-old daughter & I stayed here during the time of the year when hotel prices in NYC are the highest (December 26-January 1). Even Saint Marks Hotel quoted their regular rates but added $50 for New Year's Eve night. But even so, the total cost for the week was way under any other hotel I researched ($1250). By the way, THEY DO NOT TAKE CREDIT CARDS!! So bring Traveller's Cheques or a large amount of Cash (which I do not suggest you do while traveling!) I booked the largest (and most expensive) room: "Suite: 2 Full-size beds Deluxe". It was nothing fancy and was only a step up from a hostel. The room was actually two rooms with a partial wall between. We each had our own small bathroom (very small shower stall), flatscreen tv with remote, one chair and an open cabinet (with two top shelves) which had three hangers for our clothes. The full- (or double-) sized beds were comfortable with four pillows of varying softnesses. Daily maid service was good--except that they got a bit stingy on the hand towels as the week went on. Noise from the street was typical of anywhere in Manhattan. We just turned on the individual A/C units and let them run all night. (Even though it was an A/C unit, we could adjust the temperature to make them blow hot air.) The BIG NEGATIVE of this hotel is that there is a LARGE FLIGHT OF STEEP STAIRS to get to the hotel office. We asked for a room on the lowest floor and we were placed on the second floor. Guess what? There is ANOTHER LARGE FLIGHT OF STEEP STAIRS to get to the second floor!!! I didn't venture up to the upper floors, but I assume there are more stairways... Thankfully, the hotel staff was kind enough to help us with our large suitcases upon check-in and check-out. My daughter & I are of average fitness and it was rough for us to climb those stairways at the end of every day after going to museums, sightseeing & shopping! The best part of the stay was Ray's Pizza Bagel Cafe that is located below the hotel. They had a huge selection of food--open morning 'til late at night--with reasonable prices! I have a very restricted diet (for medical reasons) and even I could find something yummy to eat! Another great place is "The Smith" Restaurant on 3rd Avenue. It is a great bistro-style eatery. We ate a delicious Saturday brunch there. The area where Saint Marks Hotel is located is ok. My nephew (who is in finance) lives a couple of blocks away, so I figured it was safe for a mom & daughter. The hotel entrance is surrounded by tattoo shops so the atmosphere is a bit rough. Access to subway is a couple of blocks away. Also, K-mart is close if you've forgotten to pack any necessities. We stopped in there to buy cheap knit hats due to the temperature dropping to 25F!

Reviews.Title: “I don't want anyone to know about this place!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian09876
Reviews.Content: But here goes anyway: This is the only place I like to stay in NYC. I "discovered" it the very first time I went to New York and didn't realize what a steal it was. I went back a few months later and it was booked up and only then did I realize how much I love the location and the price. You get a safe, clean, air conditioned room with an LCD TV and DVD player and full cable, your own bathroom and fresh towels and a made-up room ever day, right in the East Village, for like, half the price of any other comparable room in the city. One trip, a bunch of my friends all booked rooms here (about 14 of us) and no one had any complaints, so it's not just that I'm easy to please. I stayed with 3 girlfriends once and we got 2 double beds for $160. Try to do New York for $40 a night -- try to do ANYWHERE for $40 a night -- and you won't come close to this place. Staff are pretty nice, never had a problem. If you need directions someplace, they will print you up a google map or whatever. I guess this place is not for everybody. I once heard an older lady complain that it was "too noisy" and the guy at the desk said, "Lady, it's New York!" (ha ha. I just turn on the air conditioner or fan if it gets noisy on the streets below). Yes it's cash only and there's no elevator, but if that's important to you, go stay somewhere else because I don't want this place getting too popular! One thing that's a drag is that WiFi is really expensive, but it's free without a password at the Film Academy Cafe across the street. I heard it used to be a hooker and junkie hang out, but those days are long gone. It's all families and tourists now. It was closed all summer for fire code violations and I am so glad it's open again.

Reviews.Title: “Living like a Manhattan Babe xxx”
Reviews.Author: Punkonomix
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for our 25th birthday. We were on New York a week and stayed here for 4 days, the staff were lovely, helped us with our bags, and humoured our English accents, slight drunken behaviour, hang overs in the morning, they helped with taxi's and cutting the arms off a top I wanted cutting. We made a mess with some peanuts and they cleaned up quickly with no bother. The location is perfect for young arty types, we were so close to bars, tattoo shops, funky clothes shops and million food places. Perfect in every way. Made my 25th unforgettable thank you do much!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - basic but clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: FrenchFrance69
Reviews.Content: I just stayed a couple of nights here and it was fine. Great lively location, and the hotel was clean and modern. You get what you pay for so it's not a five star paradise, but it was the best deal I found and I would definitely stay there again. I asked about them being closed recently for the fire code violations and they said that was during the summer, and they seem to be fine now.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Patrick184
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week, small rooms but when your in new york your not there to stay in your room all day. Lots of stairs no lift. You are in the heart of the village so its all good Your very near the subway,lots of resturants and bars. its a busy street so its a bit noisy Safe was downstairs which im not a fan of but you get over it. It was sufficent for what we wanted, a place to sleep. my tip would be there is a cafe down the block with a great breakfast / lunch menu called cafe orlin

Reviews.Title: “Scam!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Hotel closed due to fire code problems but still taking reservations!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: Reserved this hotel in early June on referral by a family member for stay from August 4th through the 8th. It was close to family and inexpensive but knew it wasn't top notch. Offered credit card to confirm reservation but told they don't take credit cards? Thought that was odd but... Called 2 weeks before my reservation and was told everything was set. Called the afternoon of August 3rd and told same... they were ready for us and looking forward to our stay. On the 4th we were dropped off by our airport car, baggage unloaded on sidewalk and car drove away. Turned and found the hotel doors were locked! After several minutes a man who said he was the manager invited us into the foyer and told us there was a problem... the Fire Department had closed the hotel due to fire code violations. I asked why I hadn't been advised of this when I called the day before and he pointed to a letter posted on the wall from FDNY that was dated August 3rd and cited the closure. The manager proceeded to tell us that he had taken the liberty of reserving a room for us at their sister hotel which was on 56th (?) and something, several miles from our son's apartment. I declined their offer and expressed my frustration that they had not bothered to phone me about the closure. I had previously given them my office and cell phone numbers but no call. Again, he pointed to the FD letter dated August 3rd and said they had just received the order from the FD and didn't have time to contact me. I was fortunate to find better and more reliable hotel nearby. While searching for the new hotel, I noted a review in Tripadvisor in which the reviewer spoke about the closure of St. Marks in May, 2011 due to fire code violations. This suggests to me the hotel has been closed at least since May, 2011 but they continue to take reservations and probably change the date on the Fire Department letter everyday to claim that the closure was so recent, that they were unable to contact their guests to advise of the closure and to give them time to make reservations elsewhere rather than at their 'sister' flophouse up town. This is a scam! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lot's of stairs”
Reviews.Author: GoianiaCleo1701
Reviews.Content: We went to New York in june, 2008 and stayed at St Marks for two weeks. the neighborhood was quite good. Subway station, restaurants and little markets. The hotel is a bad idea. Noisy place with a pub around. The rooms are small, there's no lift, just endless bad stairs. We asked to change rooms because of the bad fried chicken smell and Jazz noise and the staff almost laughed at us. I'll never be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Closed by firedepartment”
Reviews.Author: Arnvid
Reviews.Content: Had booked for a few nights when passing NYC on our way to Honolulu, but was very dissapointed when we arrived. The Hotel was closed 2. of May, but we had recieved no email before we arrived on the evening of 21.st of may from overseas. Staff was unhelpful, told us that they had recerved a room for us at another hotel, but when we got there the hotel told us they were fully booked. Ended up using my companys own booking system for finding a hotel in NYC as the staff was very unhelping in finding available hotels in NYC on a saturday evening. The only thing they helped us with was a computer and printer, the rest we had to do ourselves. We have a reservation for St Marks Hotel in start of June for our return trip but we have already made backup-plans. We have used St. Marks before and loved it. Friends recommended it to us because they loved it to. The Hotel needs to give better feedback to the customers before we will use this hotel again. A shame realy, as the hotel was really good value and at a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Condemned by city as of May 2, 2011”
Reviews.Author: JesseL4
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we didn't even get to stay here because when we arrived, 2 employees told us the building had been condemned! They had 18 days to email people with reservations and did nothing. Luckily, they are associated with another cheap hotel in the city, the Park Savoy Hotel on W58th St. near Central Park where they sent us but in a completely different part of the city. I do hope they get their act together since this seems like a cool place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE WORST”
Reviews.Author: Stella808
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the busiest week of the year in New York City with all the college graduations and knowing that purposely made the reservations months in advance. Our daughter's was also graduating. At check-in we found out the hotel was shut down by the city. NO EMAIL ...NO PHONE CALL ..NO WARNING. We were left walking the streets trying to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in NY”
Reviews.Author: Chandeleir
Reviews.Content: I almost always stay here when visiting NY. It is no frills, but it is very clean. I love the location. The staff is very helpful. NEVER any b.s. or hassle. Always a great price and location.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we'll stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: rebkenny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to NYC once a year and always stay here. The rooms are small and basic but clean- everything you need for a short stay in the city. By reading the reviews you should know what to expect though...bring enough cash to pay for your room, YOU are going to be lugging your suitcases up multiple flights of stairs (no elevator), the rooms are small (I mean NYC small), the temperature of your room is not adjustable and you WILL hear the street noise below (this is no different than what 90% of the residents of NYC deal with everyday). The staff have always been very friendly to us but I'm sure do not take kindly to rude people that ignorantly expect a full service hotel. Come here with an open mind, ready to enjoy the city. Definitely the best price and location you will find!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for New York”
Reviews.Author: MrsT2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in October and thought it was great. It was a small room but you should expect that if you've done your research. This is New York! Its not cheap! But you will struggle to find anywhere in this area as reasonable and the location is AMAZING. You are right in the middle of East Village life and a short walk to Greenwich Village. It is noisy at night but that's all part of New York! The taxi's hoot their horns all night, there are people doing yoga at 3am and eating noodles but this is what its all about. We usually sleep in perfect silence but you have to relax and soak it up. We had THE heaviest suitcases to lug up to the third floor. A pain in the butt I agree but its only a couple of minutes physical exertion and then its done! With regards to the room itself, it is NOT awful. Its not luxury, but you can't come to this hotel expecting to be wowed. You don't stay here to spend time in the room. Its a place to sleep, wash and store your luggage while exploring this awesome city. Our room was fine and our friends who also stayed here had no issues. They are clean and tidy. and all you need as a base for an adventure!

Reviews.Title: “the worst!”
Reviews.Author: shanayhay
Reviews.Content: 1- the staff there is extremely rude and not interested in helping in the least. plan on lugging all of you luggage up the multiple flights of stairs without even an an attempt to ask if you need help. 2-rooms are super small. i thought this would be ok because i was getting such a great price, but these rooms were closets. you had to walk sideways to get around. oh and our toilet was clogged when we first arrived. not to mention the stained sheets. 3-ridiculous noise pollution. the radiator clicked and clanked, outside traffic seemed like it was happening in the room, and the people next door decided it would be a good idea to have the noisiest "relations" of their lives. that too seemed like it was happening in the same room. gross. 4-i couldn't stand to sleep there another night, and was not able to get my money back for the next 2 nights due to a 48 hr cancellation policy. how i was supposed to know this place was way below the standard of care before i arrived, i'm not sure. but they didn't care. and the so-called manager seemed to NEVER show his face to be talked to. so i was out of the money, but it was worth it to never step foot in that place again. Conclusion: the WORST!

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Sohotel instead - do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: KECLDN
Reviews.Content: I strongly advise anyone not to stay here. I read previous reviews before booking and most mentioned clean/good location. Location is good for downtown and if clean is an overpowering smell of bleach that never dies then maybe yes! Booked for three nights. First night noise was awful with staff going up and down creeky stairs/slamming doors constantly. Second night we were woken at 11pm by a member of staff coming into our room using a key and without knocking - maybe hoping we weren't there?! A few hours later I was woken by boiling water gushing out of the raditor onto my bed. Complained about both incidents in the morning to a very unapologetic and arogant guy on reception. Asked for a partial refund and told if we left all our details with them they may be able to claim something on their insurance eventually. On our way to the Sohotel (stay here if you want a decent budget hotel) overheard man on reception laughing with colleague re a guest who had lost his wallet. Maybe a night time intruder?!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: pudlmom
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to spend $500/night so we opted out for the St. Mark's, knowing ahead of time that they would take CASH ONLY. Our reservations were made in July for our October stay and we asked to have something on the ground floor because we knew there was no elevator. We had lots of luggage as we'd been away from home for weeks. Guess what? Our room was on the third floor; had to drag 3 pieces of heavy luggage up 3 flights of stairs that were very, very narrow and steep. Ugh. That was tough. Although the rooms were immaculately clean, they were very small and sparsely furnished. The bed was comfortable and we felt safe. There was one window which faced another tall building. No ice machine. No amenities. Bed and small shower (like that inside a sleeper car on a train). Positive side was that the help was very friendly, room was clean and NO BED BUGS!!! If I ever went back there it would HAVE to be with a lightweight piece of luggage. I would recommend this hotel, but would be sure to tell anyone that it comes WITHOUT all the goodies. Very, very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town”
Reviews.Author: Palannie
Reviews.Content: The room and bath were very clean. The staff was very polite and helpful. Breakfast at Ray's Pizza was good and it was right around the corner and had outdoor seating. We were in the heart of Greenwich Village which is a bustling area of young people. Yes it's noisy but we were in NYC! The rooms are small but we were out and about all day and late into the night. If you need a fancy lobby and a big quiet room this is not for you. We stayed 4 days and wanted an inexpensive hotel with no frills so we could spend our money on other things , so this was fine for us. There is no elevator so you must have good knees. Room 25 is a queen size and looks out on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Nick1Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, superb location, close to everything. Really friendly staff and my room was immaculate. I will be back ! N Vernon Liverpool UK

Reviews.Title: “Yet again a fab stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fatshoegal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at St Marks twice before and have just got back for the third time! The staff were polite and extremely helpful. Our rooms were beautifully cleaned daily!!! Location is amazing!!! I left my handbag in a cab with money and passport and the desk staff could not have been more helpful. Yes the hotel has no frills but is wonderful!!!! I ordered a taxi at the desk to JFK which they advised would be $55 +tips!!! that was fine as its only the yellow cabs that are $45!!! Thank you again for an amazing, clean and wonderful time!!!!! Definitely a truly authentic NYC experience!!!! I got my handbag back with everything in it even the $300!!!! This would be unlikely in the UK.... Keep up the work St Marks........

Reviews.Title: “Despite the great location, I will NEVER stay here again”
Reviews.Author: missmclevans
Reviews.Content: I knew that I wasn't in for a luxury stay when I booked a room at St Marks. My friends had stayed and I knew it would be a no-frills place to sleep. The reservation noted that our room had a skylight! When we got there, I realized that was another way of saying that there weren't any real windows other than the skylight -- as in no fresh air at all. There was however an air conditioning unit cranked to the 'ice cold' setting. It was hot outside so a/c was good, but the air conditioning was so freezing that I actually got the flu while I was staying there. HUGE BUMMER. It was a pretty awesome area, lots going on, so you needed the air conditioner on to drown out the sounds from outside... and within. When it was off you could hear the creepy sounds from within. The carpets made a strange crunching noise when you stepped on them so I can only hope that the loud scratchy crunching sound that I heard at all hours was from our neighbours next door. I don't think it was rats but that's what it sounded like. When we asked the hotel staff if there was any way of adjusting the a/c temperature the two dudes at reception were very quick to inform us that there were "no settings to adjust", it was either 'off' or 'on'. SO UNHELPFUL. Luckily, my boyfriend was able to craft up a makeshift ladder out of the furnishings to hoist himself up into the skylight and turned down the knob to adjust the temperature. They just lied because they were too lazy or didn't care. The location was undeniably phenomenal. The cleaning staff were super nice. But I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: aliwobbs
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the Lower East Village, hotel staff extremely helpful and friendly. Great shops/restaurants everywhere as soon as you step out onto the street, couldn't really fault the place. On arrival we were informed that the room was actually $10 a night cheaper than we had been quoted, bargain! Not luxury but excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Location is good...”
Reviews.Author: Joanie881
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the superlatives this place is getting in reviews. Yes, it's an awesome location if you're an East Village/Lower East Side kind of person. Which I am. But damn, the door is open to St. Mark's Place all the time, staff behind plexiglass (and some guy with no shirt on was screaming at the clerk when we returned one evening then sped off), no AC in the building itself and super old fashioned AC unit in our room that clangs and bangs all nite (ear plugs helped the 2nd nite, but that was one super loud unit), ratty old blanket, shower that got warm at the best times and went cool at other times. Which in the sweltering heat of that weekend wasn't that bad but if it were winter, I wouldn't be psyched. $130 for 2 twin beds including tax is a decent price but I'll continue trying my luck with Priceline where I usually can get two real double beds in a real hotel for $120 pre tax. This is okay for a back up and I'd only recommend for location or if you really don't care about comfort at all.

Reviews.Title: “For the young and restless”
Reviews.Author: VEK_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a guy who is a frequent visitor in NY and comes to town to play and to listen to music. St Marks is great for that purpose: centrally located in East Village, lots of little restaurants around, very close to Astor Place and 8th St./NYU subway stations. Excellent breakfast at Stage Restaurant, Veselka or a Vegetarian Deli all close to each other on 2nd Av. nearby. For the price (we paid 150 dollars with tax for 3 people) you only get a very basic room: 2 beds, 2 chairs, 2 open cupboards, one little night table, shower with poor water-pressure and water changing between cold and hot (hardly ever nice and warm...). There's no elevator and the stairs are very narrow and steep. Not for the old and weak! Our room (number 29) was facing another building so we didn't get the street noise (or a view from the window...) but there was a constant noise from some machine. They told us it comes from the restaurant downstairs. Ear plugs are a must! All in all: great location if you like to hang out, not so great if you want a bit more quiet surroundings. Hotel is very very basic but we felt safe and it was clean. Anyhow, next time in NY I'll probably go some place else - unless this is the cheapest I can find...

Reviews.Title: “more like hostel than hotel”
Reviews.Author: caoh
Reviews.Content: Okay, here it goes. First of all, have cash or traveler's checks. I knew that and was prepared. Second, don't stay in a room facing street. It was so loud that my bed rattled and shook when big trucks drove by all night long. The second and final night, I moved across the hall. I was spooked when I saw the smoke alarm door hanging open with no batteries. Then, it was creepy that there was no deadbolt, but the envelope the key came in said to always use a deadbolt. I asked the employee at the desk (which is behind a locked plexiglass wall) if there was a deadbolt and he said the door would lock satisfactorily. Each room has a window unit air conditioner. Ask to stay on the main floor if you stay there because the steps are narrow and very steep. Remember no elevator. It was convenient for where I needed to be. The room was clean, bed was fine, but know it's very very tiny. Carpet was kind of dirty in the second room. I would not recommend this to a friend. It's best for students traveling. I might not have been so creeped out if someone else was in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great environment, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFan_10
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed just over a week and we found it to be fantastic. The service people are so nice, they are very helpful in anything from trip planning around the city to cost saving things to do. They were also very nice. The rooms were very clean, and were cleaned daily. Air conditioning was definitely appreciated the last half of the week we were there, as it got really warm. Nothing but great service and a very fun environment and feels very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great value and superb location”
Reviews.Author: Hozay_G
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the East Village living out of St Mark's Hotel for 8 days in 2008. Situated above a late night pizza-by-the-slice / bagel restaurant, opposite book stores, music stores and plenty of alternate clothing outlets, staying here gave me a very special New York urban experience. Slightly away from the skyscrapers further uptown, this location had a homelier, slower-paced feel. The pretty tree-lined street was always full of people - but not crowded - who were casually browsing or going for a meal at one of the affordable quality restaurants nearby. The subway, about 100m away, gets you virtually anywhere. Like other reviewers have said, the room was not particularly special and we were on the top floor (a steep walk with no elevator) but it was more than sufficient for our needs. I am a fairly fussy person when it comes to accommodation and I have recommended this to a few different friends going to NY. Staff were very friendly and helpful and when our air conditioning broke one night, they set us up in another room straight away. Our room was small but it was cleaned everyday. There are no doubt much more luxurious places to be but this place had character and it made you feel slightly part of the landscape. If it was upgraded (may have done by now) it would be worth 4.5 or 5 points.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: KarineP3
Reviews.Content: Super location, clean, good price, good service (they even spoke French!). The only regret is that they don't accept credit cards, so you have to pay cash or with travellers. I went 3 times and it was great each time. The only thing: cross your fingers no to get a room on the upper floor when it rains!

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: strawberryway
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful service. Very unprofessional, beware. My two female friends and I were told we could share a $130 room by one guy at the counter- later in the night we get a threatening phone call from the manager that one of us has to leave because the room is only meant for 2, or else they would call the police. He started hurling abuses at us for no rhyme or reason, entirely unprovoked. We tried to reason with them telling him that the man at the desk had checked all 3 of us into the room under agreement. He called us 'ignorant' and slammed the door in our face telling us to pay extra for a bigger room. We then asked for a partial refund, since we had only been in the room a total of 5 hours, but they flat out refused. We were frightened out of our wits and felt violated, and left. COMPLETELY SKETCHY- AVOID AT ANY COST.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SiSand
Reviews.Content: Minimal hotel in a great location, steps from the Astor Place subway stop. Small clean rooms, clean bathroom, clean linens and towels, friendly helpful staff. No elevator, no room service, incoming calls only in room phone. Great pub downstairs, deli on the corner for your morning coffee and pastries, breakfast or late night pizza. Blow dryers at the front desk, just ask. Be aware, cash or traveler's checks only upon check-in. You will hear the street noise and the air conditioner, take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - no value”
Reviews.Author: Xroust
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St.Mark's because a friend recommended the place to us. After a brief research of hotels online we thought that we would be getting a good value at St.Marks: for 135 USD a night we were promised a queen size bed and a private bathroom. In comparison, other hotels only offered a double or twin bed and a shared bathroom at this price. When we checked-in our first words were - WTF???!!! The room was tiny. The bed was squized into a corner so that one of us had to climb in it over the other person. The bed was sooooo hard and uncomfortable. The rest of the furniture included an old dresser without doors and a wooden chair. Nothing else, not even an alarm-clock. Stand-up shower in a tiny bathroom. One old towel per person, no shampoos or soap. The door didn't have an extra lock or a peephole. There was a 1-inch gap between a window A/C unit and a wall. All the sounds of the street were in the room. I had an impression that I slept on the street. I also could hear the neighbors as if they were in the room. Also, they have no elevators and accept only cash. The pub downstairs is a major nightmare. We stayed for two nights and moved out. We booked a room through priceline.com for the rest of the trip and ended up paying 120 USD per night in a 4 start hotel uptown. Of course, the neighborhood didn't have the "hip feel" but the room was spacious, clean with all the amenities worth 4 stars and CHEAPER! This review is not a commercial for priceline but since now we're using only priceline and no more "historic hotels"!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: dcindy
Reviews.Content: I was willing to give this a shot, based on the other reviews. The room was adequate in terms of space and cleanliness, but hovered between 85-90 degrees F all weekend. We later discovered that it must have been located directly above the pizza oven in the pizzaria downstairs. The preponderance of young European guests means that the smell of cigarette smoke is a constant problem. The worst issue though, was the noise. We learned the hard way what time the bars downstairs close (4:30 am) and how many different sounds NYPD and NYFD vehicles can make. If the heat in the room had not been so overwhelming, we could have closed the windows, but we had to make the unpleasant choice between comfort and noise. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Ollie12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St. Mark's Hotel for one Saturday night. You can't beat the free parking on the street and the low price for the stay. I only paid $120.00 for the night; a steal. The subway station is close by and the hotel location is in a very lively area, which I liked. As for the room, it was a very clean, comfortable room with a double bed (I was alone), & a flat screen tv. It was a very small space, but I was barely in the room and it was perfect just to crash for a night. I highly recommend this hotel for the price, location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Does the trick, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: stokey82
Reviews.Content: My partner & I were in NYC for 4 days in Nov. 08. The location is indeed central & the cleanliness notable. The staff were super friendly & helpful (some of them were even pervy! :)) You need to keep your expectations under control though, the double room was TINY, so was the shower, but it did the trick as we were not in NYC to spend our days in the hotel room.. We had the room at $140 (for 2 people including taxes, no breakfast) & worth mentioning that we did not suffer from any noise nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall, location is second to none”
Reviews.Author: kmshel73
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights with my husband in a second floor room facing St. Mark's blvd. The room was tiny (about 10 x 10), but clean and comfortable with a queen bed against one wall, small mounted flat screen TV, large window to view the busy street below, sparse utilitarian furniture (only room to hang a few clothing items and a shelf). There was a 24 hr pizza place on the first floor. The bathroom was tiny, but clean. The staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating, which makes a great impression despite the no-frills nature of the room. The location is perfect if you intend to see, smell and experience life in "the City". There are plenty of extremely interesting and exotic restaurants nearby - Japanese, Afghani, Ukrainian, Italian, Irish, just about every culture is represented. Lots of cool bars and interesting stores. The subway access is only a block away. We parked at a garage, also a block away - it was expensive (valet) at $24 a day, but worth it since we didn't want to have to walk a long way with all our luggage. I would definitely recommend this hotel for youngish couples and singles who are mostly interested in a cool, clean, safe place to sleep and park your stuff in while you venture out to explore the city. The location is so convenient that you can keep returning to the room to rest or stash your shopping bags. I would not recommend the hotel for people with mobility problems due to the narrow steep stairs and small bathroom, or people with excessive amounts of baggage or small children. Also, light sleepers may want to request a room facing the back of the hotel, but you will miss the view of the busy street which is interesting itself.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean & an ace base for your stay.”
Reviews.Author: LadyLDN
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this place - The staff were friendly and helpful, especially as this was my 1st time in the city & as a "young woman" on her own, there was NOT an issue. I went for a "Queen Size" room, which was big enough as I was on my own & it was located at the back of the hotel, which was great. It's a fantastic place to simply have as your base for your stay in NYC, if you're gonna be staying in the East Village or near to the area. I was there for 4 nights without any issues at all, and will go back there again when I'm next off to NYC. The room was clean as was the shower, and it was cleaned every day by the "maid service" they have there too. I stayed for 4 nights, and suggest this to anyone who is heading to the area & needs a simple place to crash with good rates & is slap-bang in the heart of the East Village.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Burton332
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for one night and it was perfect for what we needed... just a place to sleep. Yes the rooms are small, but that was fine for us. Would i stay here for a week, no. The place was clean and we had no complaints. Its right in the hub of the Village and there is a ton of things right around this hotel. I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a quieter room, ask for a room with a window not on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kaylers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at St. Marks Hotel for a long weekend stay in New York in September. It is a very basic hotel, no amenities, but it's great for what you need it for - a place to sleep! This was our first trip to NYC, so we really just wanted somewhere clean and affordable to rest our heads. Yes, it is small, but for those who are not picky over that sort of thing, it's fine. There is a lot of noise at all hours of the night, but we are from Toronto and are used to the big city sounds, so it really didn't bother us. The area is awesome. Lots of stuff to do at all hours. We walked everywhere, and felt very safe. The staff were also very friendly and helpful, and gave us directions when we needed them. I would gladly stay at St. Marks again if I wanted to save my money for the more fun activities in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones”
Reviews.Author: mcruley
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at NYC during Christmas holiday and this hotel was the only with enough available rooms for all of us. Indeed, it is an overpriced hotel since the rooms are bare bones. The bathroom is tiny and all fans noisy, not to talk about the occasionally visit of cockroaches. All rooms were so small that two people could barely move with the luggages on the floor. Only a small rack to hang the coat was the furniture in the room. We missed a wardrobe or some drawers, hence every day we had to open and close suitcases to get our clothes. The bed was ok but the blankets were old, worn and smelly. Safety box is available in the front desk but is so tiny that you won't be allowed to place there your laptop or any valuable larger than your fist. Internet is extremely expensive and very slow, try to avoid it not to feel cheated. Also try to avoid rooms in the first floor unless you have a deep sleep. Restaurants along the street are excellent, specially the Japanese ones.

Reviews.Title: “Good if U Only Seek a Place to Sleep and Shower”
Reviews.Author: JANETParis
Reviews.Content: If you read this review please go through the whole thing as I'm starting with the negative points but they are a lot of positives too. My two friends and I booked a room for 4. We ended up only three going to st marks hotel and it was a good thing cause we didn't have a lot of space to put our luggage. The room was very small so we had to keep our stuff in the suitcases and we kept on moving them around the room to gain some space, we also pushed one bed against the window, but I found out the first night it wasn't such a good idea, I was freezing all night and I ran in the shower in the morning but the water was cold. We had trouble with the heat also, it would be sometimes so hot we would open the window or we would freeze (it was pretty much the same thing in the shower) but after a while we figured that out. It is very noisy at night if ur room's on the street side(don't know about other ones) cause of street busy all night but it didn't bother that much. The first night I used my ear plugs and after we were so tired after sightseeing all day and hanging out we would crash in a sec and not hear a thing.The last thing I didn't like is the check out time, it's quite early and they call u like a half hour before to remind u, i didn't not appreciate it.We spent 7 nights there and now when we talk about it we want remenber only the good stuff since we decided to go back there if we visit again nyc. The hotel has a great great location, u can walk to lots of nice places to eat, have a drink, shop...The neighborhood is great, young....The front desk is opened 24/7 and the staff is very helpfull with ur luggage and everything u need. There was this lady (polish i think) working in the morning who wasn't very welcoming, she was so unprofessional I even thought she was the owner's wife or something so she didn't have to bother being nice to the customers. She didn't seem to appreciate us asking for a receipt every day after paying cash for our next night in. We never saw her smile and just seeing her 5 minutes everyday was enough to be unsatisfied mostly compared to the rest of employees. The receptionnists working in the afternoon and evening were both amazing, the brazilian one,really sweet, smiles all the time and it made such a difference for us to be welcomed like that after an exhausting day out .He gave us a lot of tips and directions for shopping. :-) The cleaning people were great, our room was cleaned everyday (cause we required to) the towels were changed everyday (even the days we would leave the room late).There are a lot of places to have breakfast or eat at night ((deli opened non stop downstairs). You don't need any credit card to book and once there u can pay everyday or the whole stay if u want to.There's an ATM in the hotel.The hotel is great for young people who spend most of their time out, if you're looking for a quite hotel where u can rest and hang out in the room then forget it, I would not recomend it for couples but if u're traveling with friends like I did then it's totally fine and pretty cheap for a great location. If the room's not ready when u get there u can leave ur luggage to the front desk while u're out.Same on the check out day, when we got back they had a room opened for us so we could put away our last minute shopping and be confortable carrying our suitcases. I hope this would help u and I would defenetly go back there now that I'm totally aware of all these details. Have a great stay in st marks hotel and enjoy NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: sloantr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at St. Marks for 5 days at the end of November. We thought it was a great place for the price. The rooms were small, but I didn't expect a huge room in New York City. The bed was fine, not extremely comfortable, but after a long day of walking through the city, I slept great on the mattress. The bathroom was small also, but suited us just fine. The water is a bit tricky at times, you have to adjust the knobs to get the right temperature, but I was able to bathe and not be extremely cold or scalding hot. The room itself was cleaned everyday, the beds made, fresh towels and soap. Everything you expect a hotel to do. As far as noise, we had no problems, but our window did not face the street. It was cold in our room the first two nights, and when we adjusted the heater, it became really hot and we had to sleep one night with the air conditioner on. Weird, I know, but we were not bothered by it. The location was awesome, only two blocks to the nearest subway station, and that line took you to pretty much all the big attractions. (Travelers beware: the subway in NYC is the most confusing I've ever been on! I am used to the Paris subway, and I thought that it was confusing. Not until I tried to navigate my way through the subway in NYC. I suggest buying a subway map, it will definitely help.) The hotel was around NYU, so it was lively, and there were great restaurants around. All in all, it was a great hotel, especially a great price. We will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “disliked broken things”
Reviews.Author: golding005
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend wanted to stay for 5 nights at this hotel but only stayed for one. the rooms do have new little flatscreen-tv's but they would better have invested the money in a working heating (it was only hot), a new carpet, streetnoise insulation or new matrasses. besides the broken heating, the incredible streetnoise (it doesn't make a difference whether you close or open the window), the dirty carpet and the bad matras, there was hot-cold-showering and a strange smell (food). luckily we found a new room at the larchmont hotel (quiet, clean, cheaper AND good location).

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Renavine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cheap - $140 a night in this part of the city is unheard of - by comparison I stayed in the Doubletree for $500 around 52nd street as I had business earlier in the week in the city. The hotel is very near NYU dorms so there are a lot of students and young people around at night; it is noisy and you do need ear plugs to sleep. The sheets were clean, as were the bathroom and towels. If you are going to be out in the day and only need a room for sleeping and showering, then this is a good hotel. If you are looking for a nice place to stay, then don't stay here as you will disappointed. It's not your normal hotel room - but then that would be more than double the price of what this hotel charges - so for the price, it's above average. I use the hotel to stay near where my daughter lives - if you are looking for something nicer - then stay at the Washington Square hotel in an updated room, it's only a few blocks away and stylish (but double the price of St Marks).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Price/Place To Stay In NYC”
Reviews.Author: lucky13swing
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the St. Marks Hotel in NYC and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were small, as were the bathrooms, but very clean. Every day, my room was cleaned and fresh towels were provided. Every time I came to my floor, it smelled as if the carpets had just been cleaned. The only down side to my stay, was the water pressure and temperature on the top floor. It was a hit or miss, depending on who was flushing or showering on other floors. It wasn't big enough of a problem to keep me from coming back. I would definitly recommend staying here for the price and the night life. It is perfect for young people. Next time I'm in NYC, I will stay stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, but wouldn't do it again.”
Reviews.Author: Cerne
Reviews.Content: Booked this in August for NYU parents weekend in October. I wanted to be w/in walking distance to my daughter's dorm. Everything else was booked. Read the reviews and even checked it out in person on dorm move in day. Seemed okay. I realized "you get what you pay for". However, if you want to sleep, this place is not for you--at least not Room 8--first floor overlooking 3rd Ave and st mark's place. Plusses--location, clean, cheap, comfortable bed. Big Minus-- holy cow! the street noise was incredible! sirens, car horns, people talking, etc. My daughter wanted to stay w/ me, but by midnight she left to go back to her dorm so she could sleep! It never quieted down until 4 am. There was a window air conditioner and w/ the accordian sides you may as well have the window open. Thank goodness it didn't get any colder at night. The second night I draped a towel over the whole thing to try to keep the noise and cold out. We were actually going to take the AC out and shut the window, but it was screwed into the window frame.

Reviews.Title: “Issues with professionalism, but not a bad place.”
Reviews.Author: femcastra
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were happy with this hotel in terms of location, facilities and price. There were a couple of problems that I'll detail below. We checked in at around 7pm and everything went smoothly, explored New York the next day and came back to our hotel at around 3pm. We were watching TV when the door of our room opened and another couple were standing outside, telling us that this was their room, they had just arrived. I had to take our receipt for the payment down to show the guy at the desk that we had paid for 6 nights and we had that room. The guy who had checked us in had not entered our booking on the computer and so the next person checked another couple into our room. Room keys would randomly stop working and we had to take all room keys back to get validated for the room, but it wasn't a huge drama. Lots of street noise, but honestly, given the location, it was fine. We were only there to sleep, not to party or entertain guests, so the atmosphere didn't really matter to us. Staff were mainly polite, with the exception of the guy who checked us in on paper only, he's a bit nasty to deal with. Overall, a few hiccups, but location was great, beds were comfortable and the staff booked a taxi for the airport for us the night before we left. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for tourists only needing a room to sleep and shower”
Reviews.Author: BrussoDallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for those travelers that are just looking for a place to sleep. We only went back to the room at night and for that it was absolutely perfect. It was cheap to be on Manhattan Island (140/night including tax) and was right next to a couple different subway stations (green, yellow, and orange lines and one stop away from Union Station). The area seemed safe and there was also a Walgreens a block away to get things like water, snacks, aspirin, etc. Now, onto the "bad" news, the room and bathroom are tiny (see attached picture), the toilet had a really slow leak so you had to wait about fifteen minutes between flushes, and the shower temp went through some pretty severe temperature flucutations. However, it was nice to have your own private bathroom instead of a shared bathroom. To reserve a room you must call, there's no online reservation, and you don't have to give a credit card so there's no cancellation fee if for some reason you have to cancel. You must pay for the room in cash or cashier's checks. The bed was comfy and the air conditioner worked fine. Breakfast is not provided but the shop downstairs served good bagels and such. Also no free internet (you can pay for it though) or elevator (but only 4 floors). To summarize, it was cheap, close to the subway, and felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: nonfucious
Reviews.Content: And what it is is a budget choice in NYC. 4 walls, a bed and a private bath for $150 is a deal in this city. Only 2 short blocks to the Astor place subway station. The room was small and spartanly furnished but clean and they tidied it and brought fresh towels daily. Yes, the bathroom was small. Yes, there are few places to put your clothing away so if living out of a suitcase bothers you then prepare to be bothered. We were offered a "quiet" room on the 3rd floor at check-in but since my companion had a broken foot and this is a walkup we opted for a 1st floor room. On checkout they held out luggage for us until we were ready to leave for the airport. The streets are busy in this neighborhood and traffic noise is significant. We solved the problem by walking to the nearby drugstore and buying earplugs for sleeping. The neighborhood is very vibrant with lots of nightlife and restaurants. The pizza and bagel cafe downstairs is very good and open 24 hours and there is a good bar just downstairs as well. I can also recommend Paul's on 2nd Ave for great burgers. If head shops and tattoo parlors are going to freak you out then just don't stay here. We felt perfectly safe in this neighborhood at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “In the average”
Reviews.Author: Lele75
Reviews.Content: A nice fancy location, in the middle of the mess of the Village. The hotel is old, no elevator (a problem with luggages if you are in the upper floors), not so much clean, but not so much expensive. Nice for one night in the City. The area is really "strange" full of drunk people, some drugs, but if you pay attention you will have no problems. The rooms are not so big, but neither so small. A good price for the City

Reviews.Title: “love the neighborhood, not so much the hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisamk
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel! It's located in a great area of New York (close to where my sister used to live, so I might be a little biased)...every other step is an interesting restaurant or bar, there's so much life, off the beaten path for tourists, etc. BUT... this hotel is extremely basic, even by NY standards. I booked a room for one night, and then 4 rooms for the following night because my fiance's family would be arriving. Our room was the $140 room with one full size bed. The bed was pushed into the corner and there was literally about 2 feet of space to walk on the other two sides of the bed...not very comfortable with 2 people and their suitcases. The bathroom is also extremely small....but on a positive note the water pressure was fabulous! There was no closet, but instead a basic shelving unit built into the wall with a pole about 8 inches long on which to hang clothing. Noise wasn't an issue for us, but we were on the 2nd floor, so I'm not sure if it's bad on the first floor. Be warned...this hotel only takes cash! I realized this the day I left for NY (I guess I should've read these reviews more carefully!), but if I had known before, I might have changed to a different hotel because "cash only" just sounds shady to me. In the end, it was a positive for me...my fiance and I decided to cancel our reservations for the 2nd night (we were able to find rooms at the much nicer Wellington Hotel for the same price through priceline.com-- we named our own price), and when I informed the front desk that we would be cancelling our reservation for all 4 rooms, the woman told me that there was a 48 hour cancellation policy. I quickly responded that I didn't pay anything (they had given me the option to pay one night at a time, so that's what I did), and she very angrily informed me that they would make a note of this and make sure I never made a reservation there again. I felt a little bad about possibly [----]them out of getting paid for 4 rooms, since they might not be able to book those rooms on such short notice, but then again, they choose not to take credit cards...if they had, they would have been able to charge me a fee or something for cancelling. They probably do the cash only thing so that they'll save money on taxes by not having to report all their profits, but the downside is that they have nothing on guests who decide to bail out on reservations. So now I'm blacklisted from the St. Marks Hotel. Can't say I'm heartbroken about it...To be honest, if it hadn't been for the fact that my future in-laws were traveling from across the country and I would have been embarassed to show them this place, I might have actually stayed my 2 nights at the St. Marks Hotel. It wouldn't have been the most comfortable nights of my life, but they would've been tolerable, and possibly worth it if I were able to enjoy the area. Still, I don't know that I would choose to stay there again (assuming I weren't blacklisted). I think I'm getting too old for shady hotels like this. But if you're young and can't find a better deal, I think this hotel is a decent option...but I would try naming my own price on priceline first!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: tonyshibo
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at St. Marks hotel during the last weekend in August and encountered no problems at all with the hotel. The location was excellent as it was very close to the subway station (Astor Place) about a 2mins walk and is a short subway ride from all you need to see in the city. The hotel is also within walking distance to SOHO, China Town, Canal St, etc...Our room had 2 double beds, air conditioning that worked well and wasn't loud as others have said and also had a flat panel tv with a bunch of channels. Washroom was clean and tidy although it was quite small. I would recommend this hotel for students or young singles as the area has a vibrant nightlife and is located close to NYU. Overall this hotel exceeded our expectation for the price we paid ($170/night) when compared to other accommodations in one of the most expensive cities in the world. The staff was very helpful and friendly and assisted you with any needs you might have. I would definitely go back again and will recommend this hotel to people visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “4 Walls and a Bed”
Reviews.Author: lachicken
Reviews.Content: Literally!! Even though this was the cheapest hotel in NYC, it was NOT a bargain. The saying, "you get what you pay for" rings so true with this hotel! First, they only accept cash, and you have to pay upfront. Second, all of the amenities that they list on their website is not actually provided in all the rooms. My room literally had a bed, a shelf, a tv, and a bathroom. There was no hair dryer, iron, or lock in my room. The lock would've been really useful considering the neighborhood didn't feel safe. I ended up taking all of my valuables with me each time I left the room. Also, there was no bolt on the door. No security at all at this hotel! Thankfully though, there was a single chair in the room (with no desk mind you) that I used to block the door for peace of mind. Third, there are no elevators, so if you packed a lot, be prepared to give your legs a good workout! Fourth, my room was not clean. There were used shampoo bottles left in the bathroom! Also, there were all sorts of stains on the pillow and bed sheets. Gross! Overall, the only thing I liked about this hotel was the location.. it was close to Union Square and 2 subway lines. However, I would never come back here again, nor would I recommend this hotel to anyone, even if they could only afford this cheap hotel price. Sooo not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: breilly7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed here for 2 weeks in july this yr. we are in our early/mid twenties. Booked hotel on strength of research on TA. overall it was a good choice of hotel. here are the positives: Location is excellent:East Village and one block to astor pl subway making manhattan very accessible. Room clean, hotel staff friendly. fresh towels and sheets daily. Value excellent, 150p/n for a manhattan hotel is great. great pizza and bagel bar 24hr below hotel but no smell/noise from this in hotel. Lots of interesting shops in the area to walk around, nice change to dep store shopping, find some interesting gifts. Plenty of restaurants cafes at reasonable prices. Didn't see any of the reported prostitutes (one suspect) but not an issue unless they come to my room!! Cash payment may seem strange but we had no problems with it, the staff were courteous and helped with any requests( left luggage/extra towels). room was small but adequate, shower could be better but it worked fine.hotel security seems good, cameras in lobby and noticed staff checking room numbers if they did not recognise a guest. Possible negatives would be noise. we got off street room so were not too bad but a/c was noisy and we initially had to choose between a cool or a quiet room. bear in mind it was the hottest time of year to visit ny. We bought ear plugs which are a good idea if you are comfortable to sleep with them. Overall i recommend this hotel for open minded travellers of any age who want to stay in a vibrant, interesting part of ny and get decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but possibly variability in room quality”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: Partner and I stayed at St. Mark's one Saturday night in August. We chose it for its affordability and location in the East Village. We were given a room at the very top (there are four rooms up there, 1P-4P) because I requested a quiet room not facing the street. What we got as a consequence was a room that looked a good bit more tired than some of the ones shown in photos here. The issue could be that they are still in the process of renovating up there, not sure. But, aesthetically I found it to be a good bit more on the homely side than I expected. The room was very small but adequate. Mattress appeared new but on the cheap side -- not great support but for us just fine for just one night. The AC struggled to keep up with the warmth but provided adequate cooling. Staff were decent but then again we didn't make any big demands to test this further. They let you leave luggage there for the day -- they have a tagging system and put the bags in an unused guest room. Overall, the place appeared to me to be decently clean and well-run. I wouldn't choose it over Ye Olde Carlton Arms, though, where for the same price but you get lots of character, and it's just nine blocks further up the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: punkypickle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights at the St Mark's Hotel with my boyfriend. I was a little anxious booking a hotel overseas through email alone, but I needn't have worried. We got the metro from the airport to the hotel (saved so much money!) and the best thing about the hotel is that it is so close to the metro stop (Astor Place). The guys on reception were always friendly. We were told you could pay the whole lot up front or pay day by day before 12pm. There is a cash machine down the hall. We went for the standard room ($140). It was the cheapest hotel I could find without a shared bathroom. The room was small but very clean and tidy. If I had the money I think it would be worth paying for a 2 x double room ($170) for the extra space if you were staying for a week or more. The bathroom was small but immaculate with clean towels (replaced every day) and a few toiletries. The shower was very temperamental, there was no cold water (sound like a strange complaint?) but probably just a one off. Room had a tv, wardrobe and air con. The air con was pretty noisy but we needed it, and it disguised the noise from the street. Would definitely recommend asking for a room away from the road as it was noisy all through the night at the weekend (although it died off during the week). You'll get a lot of traffic noise wherever you stay in New York though! As for the prostitutes, we did encounter one trying to check into the hotel, accompanying an elderly gentleman ;) Still, we're open minded and it wasn't like some sort of brothel or anything like some of the reviews would have you believe!! I'm sure things like that could happen in any hotel under your nose and you'd never know! As for the area, the hotel sits on top of a bar and a pizza parlour of which you could not hear or smell in the room. The pizza place was great for a quick bite or to grab some beers for the room. There's a couple of supermarkets nearby should you need anything more, and plenty more bars and restaurants in St Marks Place. St Mark's has a lot of alternative and retro clothing shops (right up my street!) and is very similar to Camden in London (should you have ever been). I loved it. It's a very cool place, however I can imagine that some types of people aren't comfortable, but more fool them if they haven't researched where they are staying! The "Colourful characters" that one person described are just students, a few punks and alternative people (tattoos, dyed hair and piercings) which is nothing compared to the gangs and prostitutes that I was imagining! This really is a cool place in an exciting part of town, easy to get to all the main attractions. Should you like the Ramones, Joey Ramone Place and the site of CBGB's is all very close by (53rd and 3rd is the other end of town and very dull!) If you need to ask me anything more feel free to drop me a message and I'll try and help you out

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: kieba85
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to New York, but the first time I would be staying in Manhatten. I found this hotel through an internet search engine a few weeks before, and through good email correspondance was able to book a room for my friend and myself. The hotel was good for the price, the location is excellent, although can be a little noisy at night, but is right next to two tube stations, that take you direct to central manhatten. The rooms are small, but well maintained with clean bathrooms, new towels everyday, air-con and lcd televisions. The only gripe i had with the rooms was the fact our blinds broke 4 days in and couldnt be fixed so we had to cover the window up with a towel for the next 3 nights! On the subject of "working girls", I didnt see any until we were checking out and it was all done very discreetly, otherwise I am sure we would have noticed it before. The staff were helpful, and gave us maps and advice, they also booked a taxi for our return to the airport. Id reccomend this hotel for groups of friends looking for a cheap, lively place to stay and for the price it is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget choice in East Village”
Reviews.Author: SampHel
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews here: decent and clean place with unbeatable price-quality ratio: a double room with taxes only 150 USD per night. The room I had was fine for one person, but would have been smallish for two. However, I guess this place is choice mostly for those who only need a place to sleep and look forward to spend their time mostly in the city, not in the hotel room, so it matters less. The location is simply excellent. I will definitively be back. An extra nice thing is that you do not have to pay them when booking, so you can more easily change the travel plans also later on.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bgunther
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. marks hotel for the 4th of July weekend. I was very happy with the room. It was cleaned each day and the people at the front counter were very nice. For $150 a night which includes taxes it can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Renze
Reviews.Content: Well my friend and I stayed here having filtered some of the reviews on here and have to say it was great. For $170 a night (all taxes and everything included) - we stayed 5 nights - we had a decent (for New York) sized room with 2 double beds in it and ensuite (if you looked out the window you could see teh Chrysler Building). We were a bit nervous when we booked as they don't take credit card bookings, only cash or travellers cheques, but we checked to confirm again our booking a week before we went and all was fine when we got there. It was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, and the best thing was the fantastic location - on the edge of the East village with funky bars and shops on St Marks Place and only 10 mins walk from Greenwich village. It was really a great location to explore Manhattan. Top tip - the bagel/pizza place downstairs for breakfast - one of their beast sized bagels for breakfast and you keep going all day til dinner! We didn't smell the pizzas at all despite the heat the week we were there! (about 30 degrees and very humid every day). The main road was a little nosey as was the air conditioning - but from experience that is the same for everywhere even in really posh hotels! The stairs were a little hard work when you are carrying two heavy cases - but for those not able to manage the staff are more than willing to help out (when we checked out 2 very pathetic girls who were travelling with cases they couldn't even lift had someone carry their bags to their room). The subway is also really close and we found it to be safe and really cheap $25 for 7 days, even at night we felt just fine. And finally NO PROSTITUTES! There were normal families and young people. We went to a wedding on the saturday and the only thing that was a minor let down was that they had an iron but no ironing board - but the beds do for ironing just fine or go along 8th street and go to a dry cleaner who will sort it easily and cheaply. Hairdryers not in the room but just ask and one will be brought to your room! GREAT place for the able bodied and anyone who is reallistic - will be delighted with the value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Liked St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: jeff_osu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at St Marks for a Spring Break trip. Compared to other hotels in Manhattan priced at over 250 a night, St Marks was a steal. I anticipated getting what I paid for, but was pleasantly surprised. We stayed there 4 nights and never had any problems with prostitutes or anything like that. Our stay was nothing but nice. The rooms were definitely small, but that is a trade-off we were willing to make for the price. One other problem is the street noise. We had a room over the street and it could get pretty noisy, even at 3 in the morning there was horns honking and people shouting. Everything was extremely clean and was cleaned everyday. Bathroom was small but completely useful. We were college students looking to find a bargain in NYC. There really is no great bargain, but this is a good as it gets. Would absolutely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the core of the big apple”
Reviews.Author: Chinkle
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by this budget hotel. The best thing is it's location right on the hip St Mark's Place in East Village. Step outside and it's buzzy 24/7. It's not the swishest part of NY but not down and out/prostitute city as some have suggested. The hotel seemed to be full of regular tourists and even families. the reception staff were helpful and the room cleaned daily. The room itself was typically small (NY sized) and didn't have a great view but it's absolutely fine for crashing and washing which is all you should need a NY hotel for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: lizzy_est
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location for a fantastic price! At $140 per night for a double what you get for your money is unbeatable. First, the location is AMAZING. St Marks Place is full of alternative shops and people, and a great location to be if you want to party. If you're going to spend all of your time in museums and Times Square it might be a little out of the way, but I loved it. The rooms are basic, but I was impressed with how nice they were. The rooms have private bathrooms, TVs and DVD players. Both the bathroom and bedroom was clean and nicely decorated. Maids come every day. Seriously, for the price it is unbeatable. I didn't see (or hear!) any prostitutes. The staff were very friendly and helpful and will provide a place for you to store your bag after checking out, and can order you a taxi if you need. There is no elevator which can be a problem if you have a heavy bag, but the staff are very helpful. I think the only problem I had was that I could hear the noise from the street while I was trying to sleep, so you may need to take earplugs. I'm pretty sure you won't find anything this good for the same price anywhere in Manhattan,

Reviews.Title: “Nice 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: ntirish
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel one night rather than drive home after a good night and dinner. The room was nice and clean the price was right. The rooms were small but the loction of the hotel more than makes up for the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean, Convenient, Affordable.”
Reviews.Author: SmooveDee
Reviews.Content: The St. Mark’s hotel has the best price to value ratio of any hotel in lower Manhattan. The rooms are small, but tidy and in good repair, the mattresses are new, the private baths are freshly tiled, and everything is squeaky clean. You will be greeted by friendly and helpful staff who take pride in providing a safe, clean, affordable stay. The location of the Hotel at 3rd and St. Mark’s (8th) is excellent, allowing you to visit museums and tourist icons in Midtown or to stroll around the Village choosing shops and dining. For us, the St. Mark’s is our home away from home when we visit NYC. I would like to respond to some of the concerns raised by other reviewers. They do not rent rooms by the hour. There is no greater concentration of prostitutes in this hotel than in any other NYC hotel. The locals, while colorful, are (mostly) not drug addled criminals. Your fellow guests are (mostly) not “weirdoes” but adventurous, young-at-heart, budget minded travelers not unlike yourself. Legitimate concerns about the hotel are few, but may be significant to some travelers. The hotel accepts cash only. There is no elevator, and some of the staircases are steep and narrow. The street life on St. Mark’s place is vibrant, sometimes noisy, and goes on into the early morning hours. This is not a business class hotel and provides few amenities beyond safety, cleanliness, and affordability. In summation, if you are an able bodied adventurer with an open mind and a positive attitude, the St. Mark’s hotel will provide you with a clean, safe, convenient stay at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “I support the prostitution review below.The staff are rude also”
Reviews.Author: virgo2408
Reviews.Content: Now I know why people were booking by the hour. At the time I thought it was people of the street using the rooms for sex with their partners. I didn't think as far as prostitution. It was all done pretty discretely. Anyway my gripe is the fact that as soon as I arrived my suitcase was broken by one of the staff. It took 4 days for the manager to appear. He was just never around. Instead of an apology all I got from the staff were dismissive comments about how the manager would appear later. I had to harass them to pin him down. It was all very shady-A hotel with an invisible manager. When he did appear, he asked for the cost of my suitcase in a brusque manner. When he gave me the money to replace the suitcase I didn't even receive an apology. I was disgusted. I will NEVER EVER STAY THERE AGAIN.STAY AWAY. It's just not worth the prostitutes and the rude, unprofessional manner of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Couples and strong healthy people”
Reviews.Author: mothermother
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was recommended by my Brother & Wife, who are a young couple. The hotel area is fine in the Morning but a night just like most areas can be Crazy looking. With Crazy looking people .. but there is also young college students walking around to Mixture of things. There are two Strarkbuck with in Blocks of each other for those Morning Coffee Drinkers like myself.. down the street is a Great little Dinner. NOW this hotel is NOT for large Groups with BIG LUGGAGE. like us who were traveling in a group of 7 ..3 to one room and 4 to the other and no ROOM to move. We also had to LUG the Luggage up Stairs.. We did get some hotel help.. but NOT a Good IDEA.. pack a carry on bag for this Hotel. Jeans, shirts, scarf, jacket and Hat and your fine..If you want to take Fancy Clothes then go to the Fancy Hotels Recommending for those first time Visit renting a Car.. we saw so much this way.. from the Bronx, Brooklyn, Coney Island, Manhattan, and everything else.. parking wasn't to bad and we could go anywhere above ground. I also found out I was a New York Driver from California.. haha.. loved NY. but wouldn't want to live there... also when going Enjoy your time there and When you have a Hotel to stay at Don't leave it.. things get BOOKED out there..

Reviews.Title: “You all forgot to mention the prostitutes and rooms by the hour???”
Reviews.Author: Yviebee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. The place was in a great location, very clean rooms, adequate amenities for how small it was and the price was excellent. I was very disappointed however, that no one here mentioned that they rent some of these rooms by the hour and that we would be sharing a hotel with prostitutes. We thought we really found our "new place" for the city. Run down and small I can deal with , but I draw the line at entering the lobby at the same time as a prostitute. The cab driver confirmed this as well. Additonally, any time there is prostitution in a hotel, other types of crime are a distinct possibility. So the St. Marks is off of our hotel list. I'm pretty let down that no one had the courage to mention that considering that travelers look to this website for solid advice. It's not always about getting a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “convenient place”
Reviews.Author: Nefeli00
Reviews.Content: After exhausting searching in the internet in order to find a nice and affordable place to stay in Manhattan, we concluded to St. Mark's Hotel.Our criteria were: located in Manhattan, the price and the private bathroom. In Manhattan there is the problem with space, so do not expect a very comfortable room.
