We stayed in a double room and if we had had more luggage (than a suitcase) I believe it would have been a problem. There was a wooden piece of furniture where we could store some things but it was not very user friendly. The bathroom was tiny but private. Our room had a window to the street and it was noisy. We do not know about the other rooms. Our room had also humidity. Another drawback is that there is no elevator and we had a lot of trouble carrying our luggage up and down the stairs. The good things are that it is in a great location, the staff is friendly, the value for money is great considering we are talking for Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “great location great value”
Reviews.Author: blueblazered
Reviews.Content: Here is a great place if you want to stay the most central place in New York. You will not find a place this central at this rate, with private bathroom and clean and nice front desk service. The subway and Broadway is just next door. The east village has all you want from good restaurants and nightlife. You can walk to West village - Soho etc. And the subway take you to all the sites. The front desk team at day time is very competent and very friendly and helpfull. You will not get a better place at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great time!”
Reviews.Author: watsycakes
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from NYC, and we stayed for 6 nights. The room, bathroom and bedding was clean, and kept scrupulously clean throughout our stay. The front desk staff is friendly and went above and beyond to help us with directions. The room is smallish and the bathroom definitely small, but the price was really good. The neighbourhood is very central, with loads of great restaurants and clubs. Both my friend and I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be centrally located and in an interesting neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: giuseppe1973
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. The location is great if you want to stay in and around the East Village. The area is buzzing at night as it is close to NYU. Some people may find the area a little daunting, but it feels safe and if you want some bars and cheap eateries then this is a good choice. The room was clean and the house keeping staff did a great job. If you want to stay downtown close to Broadway shopping, which now includes Prada, and be in walking distance to Greenwich Village then this is the place. I would recommend this hotel to single people, young people anyone on a budget. For it's price range it ticked all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “From Paris to St marks NY”
Reviews.Author: mariemarta
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend we stayed there for 7 night. august 2007 The location is wonderful; the neighborhood is simply convenient and appealing in almost every possible way. And the bedding was nice, It was a small room... but it's a great place. Great area, great atmosphere The staff are ok and friendly Specially a French spoken(Tall) guy he is very professional with good attitude very helpful (if you speak other language he is the man to look for )my friend she likes him a lot but …..lol she didn’t get a chance to….. ,probably next time . the area is one of the safest in NYC with an abundance of nightlife, cinemas, shops and bars , in the surrounding streets and avenues. You are just off Broadway in Greenwich Village. While the hotel is technically in the East Village it is central enough to let you be in the West Village in less than 10 minutes and you are a 5 minute walk from the Washington Square for sure we are going back there So if you visiting NY St Marks hotel is the right place for you The price is right, the place is clean, and no questions are asked. What more can you ask for? .But ( stay away from the tall clerk ) he is for my friend …kidding !

Reviews.Title: “Basic price for a basic room”
Reviews.Author: mom18225
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Room was basic BUT very clean. Bathroom was spotless. Is set up more like a boarding house. We stayed in a basic dbl. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: apmuj
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay- I went with family, parents et al... The restaurant downstairs served hot breakfast in the morning, rooms were clean, sheets were fresh and the subway is a block or so away. If you want to live in a very vibrant place without worrying abt bedbugs this is your hotel... as for the transient fun sorts-ummm, where were they??

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in the Village”
Reviews.Author: DonMarce
Reviews.Content: First of all, I recommend this hotel only if you are young and open minded. Me and my wife stayed 7 nights in mid-May and in three or four of them we saw prostitutes and even transvestites going out with their clients... But don't get a wrong idea; even considering this fact, this is a very good hotel, especially if you consider that you are in NYC! I'll start with the highlights: a very reasonable price for well maintained (even beautiful) rooms with pristine clean lining changed every day. Room service was excellent, beds comfortable, and an excellent location, especially if you're looking for inexpensive and good quality food and nightlife. And the most important: and excellent pub, located right outside the hotel's door, with the nicest bartenders I've ever met (thank you Dan and Anna!). Even though you have to take a Metro to go to NYC's main attractions, there's a Metro station less than a block away from the hotel. The neighborhood is very trendy and interesting, but a little bit too freak for my taste. Now the low points: First of all, it's very, very noisy (mainly due to the street), so I really recommend you to ask for an interior room. With the exception of the couple that worked in the morning, service was incredibly impolite and rude, so don't expect any useful information or help from them. Even try not to ask them anything, because they can mislead you terribly! To close my comments some tips: make a reservation by phone in advance; they only accept cash, but there's an ATM inside the hotel, and, finally, look for the hidden adult channel on the TV by manually browsing channel numbers! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Could be a bargain”
Reviews.Author: knarf74
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for a night. The location is wonderful; the neighborhood is simply convenient and appealing in almost every possible way. And the bedding was nice. But there was obviously no effort of noise-proof whatsoever. I could literally hear everything from the street and it was almost impossible for me to sleep. Oh, did I mention that they take only cash?

Reviews.Title: “Love the St. Mark's for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Oldercritic
Reviews.Content: I love this place. My wife hates it. The staff is very friendly and professional. The location is the most colorful in the city, the subway is in eyesight, Washington Square is about 5 blocks, the area is filled with students and artists... Rooms are tiny, the water temperature is erratic, the steps are steep. My wife, rightly so, has a problem with the fact - hard to believe - some people come to the hotel for just hourly romance!!! Hmmm. Bet that never happens anywhere else. It is very clean and very simple. The price is unbelievably low for a decent room with a bath in NYC. I stay here at least three times a year. I have stayed in so many NY hotels - Sheratons, the Edison, On the Ave, Belle Clarie, The Lucerne. All are ok, but the St. Marks has value and color. So when I go with my wife to New York we stay at The Wellington 31 or the Kitano. They cost twice times as much but she's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village”
Reviews.Author: dreamingfish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for five nights from the 8th to 13th April. I already knew the area having lived 2 blocks away for nearly a year and deliberately chose the place for its fantastic location. Contrary to some reports, this area is one of the safest in NYC with an abundance of nightlife, theatres, cinemas, bars and shops in the surrounding streets and avenues. You are just off Broadway in Greenwich Village. While the hotel is technically in the East Village it is central enough to let you be in the West Village in less than 5 minutes and you are a 3 minute walk from the lovely Washington Square Park. The hotel is 2 minutes walk to the 4,5,6, subway and 3 minutes to the NRW which takes you up Broadway to Times Square and Central Park. The rumours about the transient rooms are absolutely true, however we didn't see a single 'transient' guest in the 5 days we were there. There are two 24 hour free porn channels on the television, BUT you need to know what channels they are on as scrolling through the channels will not let you access them. you have to type the numbers in. The hotel is bright and airy with a lovely hand painted flower mural at the top oif the 4th floor stairs. Sadly there are no lifts and the stairs are quite steep and narrow (between 2nd and 3rd floor especially) but this was in no way a detriment to the place. We had room 36 on the third floor and facing St Marks road. Yes there was some street noise, but it was not overly loud with the windows closed. I am a very light sleeper and was only woken once when they were doing roadworks right outside our window! The rooms are small - in the double room there was about 3 feet of space around each side of the bed, a small entrance section and a small bathroom with tiny sink and shower. There was plenty of hot water - and if you position the tap correctly the temperature stays constant too. The room was immaculately clean, the furniture is old fashioned dark wood, and the closet space is tiny, but there was plenty of room for two medium sized suitcases open on the floor all week. The bed was a little hard, but the mattress was brand new with mattress protectors and the sheets were extremely clean and replaced every day as were the towels. All the staff were fantastic, very helpful and quick to fix any problems or provide extra blankets. The reception is on the first floor as you enter the building and everyone has to walk past them to enter the building (contrary to a previous report that said staff couldn't see who was coming and going). The hotel was fantastic for the money $130/£65 a night for a double, you can't beat it for the location or the price. I would definitely stay again though I might ask for a room on the second floor as those stairs are a killer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Franz64
Reviews.Content: Thank you St.Marks for the pleasent stay, we stayed 5 nights, the shower was warm, the rooms clean, not much comfort, but you just fall into bed when you do sightsseing in NYC, and therefor it'S perfect (100 metres from the next subw.-station. Geli and Franz from Germany

Reviews.Title: “Well... it Does the Trick.”
Reviews.Author: poitrine
Reviews.Content: I have to hand it to the St. Mark's Hotel, on two levels. First off, if you are looking for an inexpensive, serviceable place to overnight it in NYC, you can't do much better for your buck than this. I stayed at the Hotel for a week, stuck between the dorm I was leaving, and the shared apartment I was moving into. The staff was cool with the boxes I had to bring with me temporarily, the room was clean, and, despite the frequent circulation of transient boarders, I never felt unsafe during my stay. Oh, and the bathroom was SPOTLESS. If anything, I spent a week in one of the most interesting parts of town, and then, at only $80 a night. Best of all? They took me in without a problem, after nearly every other place in town turned me down via phone. As far as the other level goes, I'll just say it. Yeah, I have been one of those transient boarders that rents the Hotel's rooms by the hour. Basically, when you're in a hidden relationship, with no other place to go... yeah, you remember places like this one. And I'll say it - the staff is cool with it, hires out by the hour, and gives you a clean, spartan room for the purposes you have in mind. It's nothing fancy, but it does the job well. They even knock on the door to let you know when your time is up - thoughtful, huh? So, for whatever rooming purposes you have in mind, the St. Mark's Hotel has a room for you. The price is right, the place is clean, and no questions are asked. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Simple, affordable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Coco2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed in St Mark's Hotel in February 2007, after a recommendation from friends of ours. This was our first visit to New York and we needed a place to stay for 5 nights, and St Mark's seems to be one of the most affordable ones, yet in a great central location in Manhattan. The hotel is in a buzzling little area St Marks Place, which has a selection of affordable restaurants, a great bagel/pizza place downstairs and authentic bars. We stayed in a double room with own bathroom. To get to our room we had to walk up several flights of steps... We are young so it didn't bother us too much! As other reviews on this site will say the rooms are small, but they are kept tidy on a daily basis and soon you'll be fine with the simplicity. Especially we came for a quick five-day city break to NYC so we didn't plan to spend all our time in the room anyway. Negatives of the room was that ours was facing the inner court yard and the vents + airconditioning pipes made a hell of a racket when the window was open, and the antiquated radiator in the room was on a full heat, and air was leaking from it, so it hissed the first night. The ear plugs we got on the plane came to good use! If we tapped the radiator cap, the hissing would stop for a while but it started again.. However we finally - after turning the nozzle in all directions - managed to turn the radiator off, so the temperature in the room was less of a sauna and no hissing. So, a tip: request a room to the street (although bear in mind the traffic noices) so you'll avoid the vent motor noices. Also the rooms at the front have higher ceilings, which help in otherwise small room. Also the shower in our room was very bad. Firstly it took ages to get warm and then it would get hotter, hotter, hotter... Turn cold tap a little bit and the temperature would even out, only to turn freezing cold witih a few seconds from that. It was a real hit and miss every time and we had to have quick showers to optimise the consistency in the water temperature.. Certainly wakes you up in the morning! And finally, our toilet got blocked twice, which they took care of straight away... But nevertheless it is always a hassle. Staff were mostly very friendly, only the night shift person wasn't so, but all our questions and requests were dealt with upmost professionalism and quickly, so all in all very pleasant. Do stay in this hotel, if you don't mind simplicity, like affordable accommodation and do not mind lack of breakfast / room service. Don't stay in this hotel, if you don't want simplicity (i.e. no frills) and want breakfast served - or are planning to spend a lot of time in the room. I would go again, should I be as much on a budget next time around.

HotelInfo.Name: St. Marks Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2 St. Marks Place, New York City, NY 10003
